frame.name: FR_Questioning_oneself
frame.definition:
<def-root>The words in this frame have to do with a Cognizer having in mind a Question (as opposed to formulating the Question to an Addressee), potentially on a Topic.
<asf>Relation to fndata-1.5</asf> :New in Asfalda. Internal cognitive version of the communicative Questioning frame.
</def-root>

FE.name: Cognizer
FE.definition: <def-root>The person having a question in mind. It is often underspecified or it appears as subject of a support verb: <ex>FR-EX:<fex name="Cognizer">Pat</fex> avait beaucoup de <t>questions</t> sur <fex name="Topic">le déroulé de la soirée</fex>.</ex> <ex>FR-EX:<fex name="Cognizer">Pat</fex> <t>se demande</t> <fex name="Question">qui est arrivé</fex>. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Question
FE.definition: <def-root>The content of the Question <ex>FR-EX:<fex name="Question">"Que fait-il?"</fex> <t>s'interrogeait</t> Pierre.</ex> <ex>FR-EX:Kim <t>se demanda</t> <fex name="Question">ce que Pierre faisait</fex>.</ex> With noun targets, Message is not common (as Topic occurs more frequently). However, Message does occur in a PP Complement with the noun <ment>question</ment>: <ex>FR-EX:The answer to your <t>question</t> <fex name="Message">of how the company makes money</fex> is simply that it doesn't. </ex></def-root>
